website_summaries.verdict: A top marine radio and GPS unit that is a must-have aboard seagoing craft.
pros: Lightweight with a bright and comparatively large display
Battery saver mode is a nice option
Unit can be mounted on flat or vertical surfaces
cons: Somewhat large for a portable radio
LED display is bright white with no night option (red illumination)
Navigating menu features can be overwhelming

customer_reviews.title: The Best Handheld VHF ever!
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to imagine how Standard Horizon can keep improving such a mundane item as a VHF, but they do. This is my second SH with GPS and the easiest to program and use-especially with the ability to put my DSC address book on from my PC. If only the mounted units could do the same-I am sure the next iteration will! The only missing option is a scrambler. If you use DSC, this is the unit to have.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: How did the unit arrive already programed?
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived with the MMSI number already programed. Since it is not my number it cannot be used for distress calls until I can get it back to the factory to be reprogramed. We are currently on a cruise (another 6-7 weeks) we are stuck without a radio for distress calls until we get home! The Standard Horizon factory tech assured me it could not have left the factory in this condition.
customer_reviews.author: shopper extraordinaire

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product!!
customer_reviews.text: There's little question why this radio is consistently rated as the #1 hand-held VHF... quality in every respect! Even the packaging is top notch. I have a Standard Horizon Matrix GX2200 (with AIS/GPS/DSC) onboard my blue water sailboat. This is the perfect companion for crew going ashore and for trips out to the reefs in my dinghy, while cruising in the Bahamas. The product arrive in a very timely manor as promised, which was critical, since I was about to head out on a long road trip in my RV. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: WebbWebs

customer_reviews.title: Would and have bought again.
customer_reviews.text: Great radio. This is our second one. We let our original go with the boat when we sold it. Upon the purchase of the current boat we wanted this radio as our handheld. I like the gps as back up, and the distress button for emergencies. I would love a battery that would last for days but that ain't happening yet. It does last for our typical cruising/sailing times and recharges quickly. Why are electronics becoming more complicated to use? The basic functions are pretty intuitive, but the multiple menu system takes practice to use quickly. Haven't tested the floating capability and hope not to. It has handled being rained on/cockpit splashing without apparent damage.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hoffman Sr

customer_reviews.title: So much in such a small, light weight, waterproof package!
customer_reviews.text: So much in such a small package. Been testing it out before the 10 day Charter on our small Crab Potter (15'). The GPS and NAV is such a great feature. Been using it to mark our Crab Pots, and is very accurate! easy to use, and nice to not have separate gear. Knowing its all in one and waterproof the best. The Compass Mode, also displays SOG so that is great to have on that screen too. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kazuma

customer_reviews.title: This is the best.
customer_reviews.text: I needed the earlier, non-GPS version of this to get in and out of Crowley's, on Lake Michigan--the 92 and 95 Street bridges. This version is unbelievable. If you have a memory for Lat/Long numbers and know your starting point, you are never lost. If you would rather program a waypoint, or multiple waypoints, those are freebees. You have no need for a fancy GPS moving map. This is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency radio.
customer_reviews.text: This is not going to replace an on board VHF radio. What it will do is provide you with an emergency radio and emergency GPS unit providing redundancy for your on board radio and GPS. Also having the second radio allows you to check radios before you leave home with the boat. It has every feature you would expect out of a VHF radio, DSC, etc plus its waterproof and floats (it does- already dropped it at the dock). This and an EPIRB are must have safety equipment for boaters. Mine works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brown

customer_reviews.title: terrible customer service from Standard Horizon
customer_reviews.text: Radio worked fine for about 6 months but then never achieved a full charge. Have to use Alkaline batteries to get all bars showing on the radio display and to have a normal day-use on the water. Don't expect normal battery life from this radio and if you contact Standard Horizon Tech support, they will fight you on the issue. Dozens of man-hours and dozens of calls and emails spent dealing with the issue on both sides when all SH could had to do was to replace the battery or radio. I've moved back to iCOM.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Safety First
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as backup radio for my boat and as a radio to take with me in my backpack when on other boats. Lets face it we all have friends who do the bare minimum to keep their boats running. Plus, if I have to bail out of the boat, it is far better to have a radio in my hands. This is a great little radio. Display is easy to read and buttons have good access. Too new to judge the battery life, but so far it is holding a charge.

customer_reviews.title: Dosn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: i'm sending mine back for the second time since I purchased it a 18 months ago. The unit stopped charging after about 6 months. It became very hot in the charging cradel and wouldn't hold a charge. I got no reading of voltage at the charging station so I replaced the power feed. Still no charge so I replaced the battery. Still won't charge so I'm out $80 and now have to return it again and pay the return fee. Failing twice in 18 months is not acceptable.

customer_reviews.text: Just got mine in the mail. Charged the battery and took it outside. Within 5 minutes there was condensation on the screen. Sending it back for a replacement. I'll update the review when I get the second one. UPDATE I guess some trolls are unhappy that I didn't update my review so here you go: Amazon replaced my defective unit and the new one has worked well. Statistically I don't know how many come from the factory like that but it was 50/50 for me. I'm just reporting real life events. Not trying to make anyone mad.
